website_summaries.verdict: A sound choice for consumers who prefer a traditional broom with natural features, though it does not clean as effectively as others we tested.
pros: Stands out for being a traditional broom with a corn fiber head
Ideal for indoor use and small jobs
cons: Some testers noted that the bristles have the tendency to splay when used for heavy-duty jobs

customer_reviews.title: A very good broom and now at an even better price!
customer_reviews.text: See my pictures of this broom after 17 months of outdoor use. I ordered a new one at a price of $16.96. Between the time of purchase and delivery the price decreased to $10.30 and Amazon was kind enough to refund the $6.66 difference. When was the last time an item was reduced 40%? Is it being discontinued? It's made in Mexico. Have wages in Mexico become worse? I'm tempted to order another. As you can from my pictures, the first broom was well used. I would suggest not leaving it outside. When new, the broom is also good for indoor use on carpets as the fibers are sufficiently stiff to remove small debris.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Darwin

customer_reviews.title: Broom not a Daily Driver
customer_reviews.text: These brooms are not 'daily drivers'.. My brooms arrived Feb. 16, 2016. I kept one in the house and took one to the barn to sweep rubber mats. The barn broom wore out very fast with daily use. Picture attached taken April 5, 2016. The house broom which is not used often is still ok (I vacuum the house). The wear on the broom on the right is less than 2 months old.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Hess

customer_reviews.title: Worst broom I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I don't think I've ever given a product a 1 star rating before, but this is the worst broom I've ever owned. I'm surprised by the number of people that seem happy with it. Perhaps I just got a lemon. The one I received was thin to begin with -- just not that many fibers. And then they started falling out almost immediately. Despite very limited usage the broom developed visible gaps in the the fibers within a few months and became useless. I would never buy another broom from this company.
customer_reviews.author: ALBFRU

customer_reviews.title: Not that Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: After putting up with ridiculously and clearly inaccurate information, over and over again, regarding the shipment of this broom, waiting nearly a month for Amazon to produce it, and needing to grab it from my neighbor's house where it was erroneously delivered, I am less than impressed. It's certainly a solid outdoor broom and a good weight, but the bristles are not stiff enough to warrant a "heavy-duty" or "industrial" rating. It works for my purposes, and I would buy it again for my current needs, but if you need a broom for industrial or near-industrial uses, buy at your local hardware store where you can "test drive" your options.
customer_reviews.author: Elisabeth Culley

customer_reviews.title: Heavy ole thing!
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be a good choice for keeping my new, large composite decks swept off. WRONG!!! This broom is entirely too heavy and stiff for a 74 year old widow with physical ailments to use easily. I will go back to the light weight angled broom. That being said, not everyone is my age nor in my physically challenged state, so for the majority of folks who want a sturdy, stiff, long lasting broom, this one's for you.
customer_reviews.author: Margie Hudgins

customer_reviews.title: Good brooms at a good price!
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to find a good quality, standard heavy duty broom with broom straw and a heavy wood handle. The big boxes, including Home Depot and Lowes, only carry models with tubular (thin) steel handles, which are subject to failure in my experience. Amazon had these in stock, and they were actually slightly cheaper. The definition of a satisfied customer is someone who gets what they want at a price they can afford.
customer_reviews.author: J. H.

customer_reviews.title: Balding Broom
customer_reviews.text: Heavy broom. But the Brissels are falling out like crazy. Which causes me more to clean up than I started with. My broom will be bald within a few weeks. I do NOT recommend this product.I would return it, if I didn't wait so long to open it. (my fault).
customer_reviews.author: Busy Mom

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with this broom.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice well made broom. This is different from the one you will find in the stores because this one is more thicker and heavier. The one in the store is lighter and thin. I like this one. I'm glad I bought two so I have a spare. This broom is going to last me for several years because of the way it is made. I am very satisfied with this purchased.
customer_reviews.author: genie

customer_reviews.title: Drops bristles, slow shipping
customer_reviews.text: Shipping was delayed twice, it took over a month to receive this broom. I purchased it to use in the house on our textured hard floors. I love corn fiber brooms and was excited to get this. The stiffness of the bristles is great to get into the grooves of wood and stone tile, but unfortunately it drops fiber like crazy! I can only use it outside :(
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: real broom for real sweeping
customer_reviews.text: I'm old school in a lot of ways (refuse to have/use a blower on my deck, porch, and walkways because that's just lazy) and love that this is the type of broom I grew up with and remember (versus a lot of the plastic junk I see now). Well made, feels good in your hands, and brooms as a good broom should. I'm on my second one as the corn fiber bristles do wear down over time, and I held back from 5 stars because it does drop stray bristles now and again, but all in all this is a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: C. Meagher

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last!
customer_reviews.text: Even with light use the ends fray and fall apart. Bought 2, they both failed.
customer_reviews.author: SD Pete

customer_reviews.title: Great traditional broom!
customer_reviews.text: ***2016 Update: It is still a broom, still sweeps, and still does a great job of it. It STILL hasn't lost any bristles, and even survives the imagination of a 6 year old playing Harry Potter with it. I wish everything I bought in 2013 was this sturdy and reliable. It's a broom. It sweeps. It does a good job of it. It's not too firm, not too flexible. It hasn't started loosing any of it's bristles yet (and doesn't show any signs of doing so in the near future. It's a real, full size broom, and I'm glad I was able to find one so nice for such a decent price! (I really don't like the all-plastic ones)
customer_reviews.author: asineth

customer_reviews.title: A sturdy, old-fashioned broom!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent broom! Big and beefy. Bristles are stiff enough to use outdoors (which is what I bought it for). Good for sweeping porches, sidewalks, etc. I expect this broom to last for a decade or so, judging by how robust it seems. I drilled a small hole through the handle and threaded in some wire to help me hang it up. No big deal. Pros: -Big -Sturdy -Well-built -Stiff bristles Cons: -May not be the best for sweeping hair and dust (get a broom with softer bristles for this).
customer_reviews.author: C. Kopp

customer_reviews.title: Great broom for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I have one in my barn and one in my horse trailer. Use the barn one every day to sweep stalls and the aisle and so far, so good! We have a 2 stall barn, so it works for us and I see it lasting a long time. Not sure if you had a bigger barn and more daily sweeping how it would hold up but I think it would be good!
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: SOLID WOOD HANDLE, PLENTY OF BRISTLES AND BUILT TO LAST
customer_reviews.text: FINALLY!! If you are looking for that old fashioned big sturdy corn broom you used to have back in the day and could use inside and out and would last 5 years, THIS IS IT!! I am embarrassed to say how many brooms I bought that said "heavy duty" in the description but were no different than the fall apart undersized imported products you can get at the grocery store. It finally dawned on me to check the listed weights used for shipping. The old style well made corn brooms like this one, with thick solid wood handle ARE HEAVY.
customer_reviews.author: G. A. Hanan

customer_reviews.title: Great Outdoor Broom!
customer_reviews.text: A little expensive for what you receive, but I got this broom for outdoor sweeping, and it works beautifully for that. It feels well made and sturdy, and has been very effective in cleaning my porch and deck so far.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Ward

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, well-constructed broom
customer_reviews.text: When I swept the floor with this nice, natural corn-fiber broom, it picked up a lot of stuff the plastic broom had left behind. The broom is heavy and well-constructed. My only complaint is that the handle is so thick that I couldn't attach my clip-on dustpan (but not everybody has a clip-on dustpan, so it's a small matter). And, oh yes, it has no hanger hole in the end. But the price is great; I just drilled a hole in the end for hanging, and that fixed it just fine.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wiles

customer_reviews.title: Great broom!
customer_reviews.text: It took me a while before I found this particular type of broom, so I was very pleased when I found it and for such a good price! I really try not to purchase plastic products which is why I was looking for a wooden handled broom. It's very sturdy, including the bristles. I'm actually going to purchase a second one to use on my patio, and garden pathways.
customer_reviews.author: JRN

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a corn broom without yucca. This is exactly that and durable! These are so much better than the synthetic brooms. Two swipes with this one gets everything instead of the many swipes of a synthetic broom and still missing some of the fine dirt. I'll be getting more for Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: Galadrial

customer_reviews.title: Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Excellent strong broom, suitable for both the kitchen floor and outside balcony. Don't think you could get a better broom for the price...nice to see some quality and not a piece of plastic rubbish...or made in China for that matter. Good all round '
customer_reviews.author: Francesca

customer_reviews.title: Adequate Broom
customer_reviews.text: I tried it for indoors and I didn't like that so much so I decided too make it an outdoor porch broom for my concrete patio. It gets the job done for most but particularly heavy messes which is great. The box was just huge. Not really a problem but the jerks at my post office thought it would be funny to toss it at me. Luckily it wasn't heavy. But I still didn't catch it. Pretty lame joke to play. Overall it's a pretty good broom.
customer_reviews.author: OngoingSky93

customer_reviews.title: Better then the $20+ Hardware Store Brooms
customer_reviews.text: Gave this as a gift, and its worked better then the prior broom (Amish style) we had which cost $25 at the hardware store. So half the price, 10x the performance. So far its holding up well... and is both light but sturdy with solid hand weight. Only complaint is it started loosing its bristles out of the box, but then again... its a corn broom and they ALL do that.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: A Broom!
customer_reviews.text: An actual, true-to-life broom. Not one of those things with the metal handles that melt and crack if you're trying to sweep up a mess. Wonderful. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Who needs a vac? Not me, for now...
customer_reviews.text: Recieved my broom yesterday. I ordered it because all I can seem to find in the stores around me are plastic bristled brooms that don't Iast or hold up well. I was only going to use it the kitchen and bathroom but the carpets in the living and bedroom are pretty threadbare so I decided to try it outon the living room floor, to my surprise, the broom worked better than my vaccuum! Honestly, my vaccuum needs replacing, but the broom is taking over til I can get a new vac. This is no Nimbus 2000, I'm not winning any Quidditch games with it but it's still pretty super.
customer_reviews.author: R.Smith

customer_reviews.title: This is a good quality TEN YEAR broom.
customer_reviews.text: Everybody in my family loves this broom. The quality is like something you'd expect from the 1950s. I'd bet it will still be hanging in my pantry ten years from now. There is nothing else - in brooms - that works like well made STRAW broom. Dirty? Swish it in soap and water, and as good as new. The price is unbeatable. First and foremost, it sweeps like a champ, gets in corners - washes down exterior walls, and stone walk-ways with ease.
customer_reviews.author: GeorginaK

customer_reviews.title: Nice stick, but the broomhead isn't so great
customer_reviews.text: The broom part of the broom is separating and not holding its shape after only a few days. The broomstick, however is stout and well made. I bought it for sweeping, though and its frayed shape isn't much good for that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worthless. We've had it less than six months. ...
customer_reviews.text: Worthless. We've had it less than six months. It is used maybe once a week on light duty stuff to tidy up around the patio. The "corn" is falling out and then the broom won't sweep up it's own mess. It sweeps everything (leaves, etc) poorly.
customer_reviews.author: MalibuBill

customer_reviews.title: The least expensive broom out there
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these, since I used them for the outdoors to sweep leaves off the stairs & concrete walks. Unfortunately, these are just not made as strong as the ones in the past. Already, I am seeing pieces coming out when I sweep. Hope it holds out for a year at least. Yet, they keep raising the prices on all brooms...in the local hardware store, the same broom is selling for almost $20. So in comparison, this is a very good buy. One word of advice: Always store it out of the rain. Water breaks it apart even faster.
customer_reviews.author: IldiVt

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Amazed at the quality of this broom, especially for the price. thick, sturdy, surprising!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L

customer_reviews.title: Sweeps clean
customer_reviews.text: The biggest problem I have is that it loses a lot of bristles. It sweeps clean though even though I have to pick up straws when I'm done.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Quality craftsmanship!
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made, all natural materials, broom. I've never has a broom I was proud of before, but the beautiful wood handle and the authentic materials in this broom make it feel like a craftsman's tool. I had a friend over admiring it - (even smelling the fresh straw and wood shaft). She said if she were ever to ride a broom, this is the one she'd choose. Worth a little more!
customer_reviews.author: J. J.

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY Corn Fiber Broom Highly Recommended!
customer_reviews.text: Now THIS is a broom. Not those cheap plastic brooms where the handle keeps coming out from the brush base. Those brooms may be a bit less expensive, but they are cheap. This corn fiber broom is quality. It's what we always had in a time where there was no choice. From now on, I'll choose this one; however, it will be many, many years before I'll need to purchase another one. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kat LeonTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my old broom
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed when this arrived but I guess things just aren't going to be made like they were 5 years ago. Corn fibers are fairly thin & loose. I'll be surprised if this broom lasts 2 years. The length is good & I'm 5'7", comfortable to use. Doesn't do a clean sweep due to the less dense bristles. This won't be making my housework any easier. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: Peg

customer_reviews.title: what a beauty!
customer_reviews.text: It a wonderful broom,..this one is made like they were made long ago,...nice thick heavy handle..fragant broom-straw, nicely stitched and the most old-fashioned metal band, (you can see in picture) that help weights it to the floor so you don't have to push broom to floor to sweep ....a must buy item,,,,me happy.
customer_reviews.author: wendy champion

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Broom
customer_reviews.text: Gnarly big broom kicks butt! Very durable and cleans dirt and things.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I bought this specifically for cleaning webs from a basement ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for cleaning webs from a basement that sat unused for 5 years, it worked very well, I was able to stuff it in corners and up in the rafters. Used it to clean out the garage and on the front porch, it gets the stuff out of my entry mats. I wouldn't use it in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Pillitiere

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: The broom is excellent length, has not lost any bristles that I have noticed and for the job I needed it for it has done a great job. I needed it to sweep grass off my sidewalk after mowing and it has been the answer to my need. It is well made and sturdy. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Kevster54

customer_reviews.title: Quicker cleanups & last longer
customer_reviews.text: There's nothing like a corn fiber broom. They work great and last forever, unlike modern synthetic bristle brooms. They're also larger and take less time sweeping.
customer_reviews.author: SD

customer_reviews.title: Straw bristles breaking after 60 days.
customer_reviews.text: Weiler products are generally solid unfortunately not the case with the broom. The broom bristles at the top of the broom are breaking and of course outside the return/replacement window. This broom has had light use and the bristles that are broken do not come in contact with surfaces when used.
customer_reviews.author: Searcher

customer_reviews.title: Clean Sweep
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to find a good sturdy broom these days that really gets the job done. This one is great for sweeping up scraps on carpet, for use on tile floors, or for porches and decks and garages. Very sturdy handle and bristles stiff enough to handle all those tasks with ease. A friend admired mine so I ordered one for her too.
customer_reviews.author: Merica Saint John

customer_reviews.title: A REAL Broom!
customer_reviews.text: This broom is a heavy duty work horse that will stand up to serious use for many years. There's enough density in the straw to pick up even the finest dust and enough strength to collect any kind of particles and debris. One star off for weighing a ton! The handle is like wielding a telephone pole! But since I rarely sweep very long at a time that's okay. Nice product!
customer_reviews.author: karla kenyonTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Great broom
customer_reviews.text: When this first arrived and I used it, it was shedding like mad. The shedding stopped after a few days of regular use. This broom is great, heavy, comfortable handle and very sturdy. I mostly use it in my kitchen/living area but it would hold up outdoors on the deck and porch well too. Very pleased with it and it's pretty awesome value for money!
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: I AM SATISFIED
customer_reviews.text: Don't know why I can't buy this at local store anymore. These seem to work fine. Much better than the plastic and metal ones they sell in US stores today.
customer_reviews.author: Tucson John

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty broom
customer_reviews.text: My wife bought this broom. I couldn't believe she spent this much on a broom. It definitely functions like a broom should. It is also pretty heavy duty. The straw things break off the end, but then I can still use what remains to sweep those up too. All in all, good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: steven mathews

customer_reviews.title: Not new looking from the box on the handle.  Discoloration on handle, some of straw pulled out.
customer_reviews.text: What to use on a thick carpet and on concrete, and patio area
customer_reviews.author: Dotty

customer_reviews.title: It’s okay
customer_reviews.text: Very big! Wasn’t expecting it to be so large. Which is fine. I wish it was woven better everything keeps falling out
customer_reviews.author: BabyBear27

customer_reviews.title: Sub par...
customer_reviews.text: Not a good broom. Spend a bit more and you will find the quality to be so much higher. A great broom is:
customer_reviews.author: taken

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: This broom isn't "heavy duty". I've used it about three times and each time the corn fiber bristles fall out. Sadly, once again deceptive marketing. I will do my best to avoid buying another product from the Weiler Corporation.
customer_reviews.author: Teddy Bear

customer_reviews.title: Can't be beat!
customer_reviews.text: It's the best broom I've ever flown on!!! Really . . . . I don't know why we ever switched to those plastic man-made poly-whatever brooms they came out with. You just can't beat the old-fashioned corn straw brooms like grandma used to use!
customer_reviews.author: Lss4Him

customer_reviews.title: Perfect outdoor broom
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for outdoor use. Durable, well-made, and exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Summer S.

customer_reviews.title: No more wimpy brooms!
customer_reviews.text: This broom is the bomb! Cleans off the deck and the wooden stairs in one swipe. Sturdy bristles will even sweep off wet leaves and those dang helicopter seed pods that fall from the trees. I do wish it had a drilled hole at the handle so I could hang it up -- and not bend the bristles in the closet -- but the hubby said he could drill a hole lickety split for me!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy, wide handle
customer_reviews.text: The broom has a large round handle. I'm not a small person but it is difficult to grip and the broom itself is quite wide with the bristles. As another reviewer mentioned, bristles are falling out. I've relegated this broom to the garage and driveway. Still need one for the house.
customer_reviews.author: pennypie

customer_reviews.title: Wielding a tree trunk
customer_reviews.text: The good news is that I ordered this particular broom because of the corn fiber "brush," and it's exactly what I hoped for. Yay! The bad news is that the handle is disproportionately large and heavy. It's like trying to wield a tree trunk. I think even Paul Bunyan might find this broom handle too hefty.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy Lockett

customer_reviews.title: held up nice so far
customer_reviews.text: Use it for outdoors. Steps, patio, porch. Works well, held up nice so far.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It would be better for outdoor garage use
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty broom. I purchased it for indoor use. It would be better for outdoor garage use, the brushes are very sturdy, but as such are also kind of rough-- my wife is scared its going to scratch the wood floor (likely a very unfounded fear), but as such I'm not allowed to use it in the kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: 81pez

customer_reviews.title: Well made, no excuse now...
customer_reviews.text: Outstanding broom! Hard to get fired up about a broom but this is well made, sturdy and should last for years. We have worn out straw brooms before but I think this one will last much longer than its predecessors. The wooden handle is worth the price of the broom.
customer_reviews.author: GP AlaskaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but it lasted as long as the one I ...
customer_reviews.text: Heavy but it lasted as long as the one I purchased from dollar store. The straw falls out all over the place when using. I purchased a Roomba!
customer_reviews.author: JadeInVA

customer_reviews.title: Not good for delicate surfaces
customer_reviews.text: I think this broom is best for very sturdy surfaces (tile, concrete) I used it briefly on our wood kitchen floor, but felt the bristles are too harsh and left little micro scratches. Now I use it for the garage/patios and it's great for that
customer_reviews.author: Alice Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Not your ordinary hardware store variety
customer_reviews.text: This is the broom you need when you realize that the ones you've been buying aren't at all what you bought in years past. This the real deal with the stout large-diameter handle and thick rugged mane of bristles. We use it to sweep our tile halls as well as outdoor patio and sidewalks. It does it all without shedding bristles as it goes.
customer_reviews.author: K. Clemons

customer_reviews.title: Not great standards. It still works
customer_reviews.text: There is a permanent dark blue marks on the end of the handle. The handle is splintered at the base and they put the product sticker over it trying to hide it. Not great standards. It still works, but it isn't as nice as I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Weller 44008 Corn Fiber Broom
customer_reviews.text: We live in the country with two dogs going in and out the patio door several times a day so that was the main reason for buying this broom. Also very useful to clear snow away from entryways. And one of the cats will munch on a single fiber for a snack.
customer_reviews.author: Margie D. Reed

customer_reviews.title: Good, Long Handled Broom!
customer_reviews.text: These days, it is hard to find a real broom, instead of the plastic pretenda-brooms so prevalent in the stores. This is a good, sturdy straw broom that is well constructed. It ain't gonna fall apart at the first use. Better, it has an extra long handle that makes it great for tall people. (Probably works OK for short people, too!)
customer_reviews.author: John and Erika Keyes

customer_reviews.title: Great heavy and sturdy broom for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great heavy and sturdy broom for the price. I have used a number of times to clean out my garage and feel like the brush/bristles will hold up even when sweeping wet surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Sweet new ride....EeeeEEEEEeeeeee
customer_reviews.text: Love corn stalk brooms - loved the price on this one, only swept with it a few times and its lost a couple bristles, hopefully that isn't going to be a norm and hopefully it lasts a long time - my only request is to add a little shape to the broom...it's hard to sweet corners with a square cut broom.
customer_reviews.author: Nif

customer_reviews.title: Great broom, great price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great old fashioned broom. It is really big and sturdy. Sweeps better than those cheap plastic brooms that always break and crack in half. Good for sweeping outside and it really gets into those nooks and corners to sweep away the spider webs and other outdoor things that you don't want to touch. The price is great too!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin12958

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this as an all-purpose outdoor broom for nearly any ...
customer_reviews.text: Works very well for clearing up the caked mud I tracked all over the garage and walkway from digging fence posts. No lost bristles so far. I would recommend this as an all-purpose outdoor broom for nearly any heavier substance (dirt, gravel) on rough surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: Luke McSweeney

customer_reviews.title: Great Old-School Corn Broom!
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult (apparently) to find a heavy-duty corn broom that will work good on sweeping rough stone patios or similar outside ground. The Weiler 44008 Corn Fiber heavy Duty Branded Warehouse Broom does the job nicely. Too bad the big box hardware and building supply retail outlets don't seem to carry it in their store inventory, but glad it is at least available online.
customer_reviews.author: bravopauly

customer_reviews.title: very nice quality
customer_reviews.text: Gets the job done. Very sturdy and hair sticks less on this broom. I could have bought it t wal mart for a lower price, but overall it is a good broom. None of the fibers are falling, but a few of them are bending.
customer_reviews.author: Alvin

customer_reviews.title: Pseudo "heavy duty" corn broom
customer_reviews.text: This broom IS NOT heavy duty---maybe, medium duty. It needs double the corn fiber to be heavy duty--I compared it to an old broom in my garage. They kept the description but cut back drastically on the material that goes into a "HEAVY DUTY CORN BROOM"--keep looking!
customer_reviews.author: gobs1

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, old fashioned broom
customer_reviews.text: Really was surprised at the sturdiness and how well made this broom is. Would have given it five stars except 12 straws broken around the neck that comes out of the wire. Do not know if caused in shipping, altho packed rather nicely, or if was shipped this way. Would still recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Snowbird

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: A straw broom and no plastic. Sturdy, easy to use and best of all will last for a long time. If I do have to get a new one at least this one will decompose in the landfill.
customer_reviews.author: Sharia

customer_reviews.title: Very nice broom so far
customer_reviews.text: Very nice broom so far. I was so sick of the synthetic bristles and decided to give this a try. I really like it because all the nasty dust and cat fur doesn't stick to it!
customer_reviews.author: C.W.

customer_reviews.title: This is a terrific broom. I got one for my Mother
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrific broom. I got one for my Mother, Sister, and myself. It has a thick, sturdy wood handle, and the broom is also thick and well made. Plus, NO SHIPPING CHARGE. I bought a broom at Walmart...shorter, skinny, small. I have not used it yet and I am going to return it. These are very good. Also, received very quick.

customer_reviews.text: Clean up with this traditional style broom. Sturdy, thick-handled, well woven, stitched and wired. My local feed store went belly-up a couple years ago and no one else in town carries the old fashioned wood handled corn straw brooms I love so well.

customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for - a sturdy old fashioned corn broom for outside! I am a petite 5'3" and have no problem with the weight or size. It's well-balanced and sweeps up even the finest dirt. Love it.

customer_reviews.text: I purchase a broom or two every year as the reality is that they do not last. I love that the pole is wood and can be recycled at the end of its life. Will continue to purchase as needed!

customer_reviews.text: Handle could be longer, but it's not like it was misrepresented or anything. Good quality, good example of a product that only got worse with newer iterations. Glad I'm not buying crap plastic brooms with handles that break and bristles that constantly fall out.

customer_reviews.title: nice
customer_reviews.text: It's made in Mexico...just FYI. A little stiff, but I'm hoping after a while the bristles soften up a bit. Some have come loose, so I just sweep them up. I've seen similar hand-made ones for 5-6 times the price of this one, so this one can't be beat with price.
customer_reviews.author: kosmo

customer_reviews.title: These are the heavy duty brooms with the nice large diameter handles
customer_reviews.text: These are the heavy duty brooms with the nice large diameter handles, not like the ones you get now at most of the local "box" stores that don't last very long. These are well made and should last for years, at a very good price point here on Amazon.
